characters.<metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0011.09">X</metamark><lb n="c56-0011__left_margin__1"/><metamark>X</metamark> yet <lb n="c56-0011__left_margin__2"/> there was an <lb n="c56-0011__left_margin__3"/> harmony in <lb n="c56-0011__left_margin__4"/> that very diss<lb n="c56-0011__left_margin__5"/>imilitude– <lb n="c56-0011__left_margin__6"/><metamark function="separate">_____________</metamark> I was more calm and phi<lb n="c56-0011__main__8"/>losphical than my companion <lb n="c56-0011__main__9"/> Yet I was not <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0011__main__d2e150"/>n<del eID="c56-0011__main__d2e150"/> so mild or yielding. <lb n="c56-0011__main__10"/> My application was of longer endurance <lb n="c56-0011__main__11"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0011__main__d2e158"/>than hers<del eID="c56-0011__main__d2e158"/> but it was not so severe <lb n="c56-0011__main__12"/><del rend="strikethrough" n="c56-0011__main__15"/> drawing & music.<metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0011.13">X</metamark><metamark function="displacement">X</metamark> I delighted in investigating the facts relating to the actual world, she busied herself in <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>following the aerial creations of the poets.– The world was to me a secret which I desired to discover,–to her it was a <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0011__left_margin__d2e258"/>haven<del eID="c56-0011__left_margin__d2e258"/> vacancy which she sought to people with imaginations of her own.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0011__main__16"/><del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0011__main__d2e279"/>When I<del eID="c56-0011__main__d2e279"/><del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0011__main__d2e283"/>I had<del eID="c56-0011__main__d2e283"/> My brothers were consi<lb n="c56-0011__main__17"/>derably younger than myself but I had <lb n="c56-0011__main__18"/> a friend <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0011__main__d2e294"/>who<del eID="c56-0011__main__d2e294"/><del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0011__main__d2e298"/>who<del eID="c56-0011__main__d2e298"/> in one of my school <lb n="c56-0011__main__19"/> fellows who compensated for this. deficiency. Henry <lb n="c56-0011__main__20"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0011__main__d2e310"/>Carignan<del eID="c56-0011__main__d2e310"/>Clerval was the son<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0011__main__d2e317"/>s<del eID="c56-0011__main__d2e317"/> of a merchant <lb n="c56-0011__main__21"/><del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0011__main__d2e323"/>an<del eID="c56-0011__main__d2e323"/> of Geneva <del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0011__main__d2e326"/>and<del eID="c56-0011__main__d2e326"/> an intimate friend <lb n="c56-0011__main__22"/> of my father<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0011__main__d2e331"/>'s<del eID="c56-0011__main__d2e331"/> – he was a boy of singu<lb n="c56-0011__main__23"/>lar talent &<del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0011__main__d2e341"/>fancy<del eID="c56-0011__main__d2e341"/> fancy I remember <lb n="c56-0011__main__24"/> when he was only nine years old he <lb n="c56-0011__main__25"/> wrote a fairy tale which was the <lb n="c56-0011__main__26"/> delight and amazement of all his <lb n="c56-0011__main__27"/> companions. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0011__main__d2e353"/>Like Don Quixote<del eID="c56-0011__main__d2e353"/> his <lb n="c56-0011__main__28"/> favourite study <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0011__main__d2e360"/>was<del eID="c56-0011__main__d2e360"/>consisted in books of chi<lb n="c56-0011__main__29"/>valry& romance and <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>when very young, I canremember that we used to <lb n="c56-0011__main__30"/> act plays composed by him out of <lb n="c56-0011__main__31"/> th<mdel>is</mdel>ese<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0011__main__d2e399"/>favourite<del eID="c56-0011__main__d2e399"/> books, the principal <lb n="c56-0011__main__32"/><del instant="true" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0011__main__d2e405"/>car<del eID="c56-0011__main__d2e405"/>characters of which were Orlando <lb n="c56-0011__main__33"/> Robin Hood, Amadis and St. George– <lb n="c56-0011__main__34"/> No youth could could be more happy<lb n="c56-0012__main__1"/> than mine. – <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e424"/>Our<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e424"/>My parents were indul<lb n="c56-0012__main__2"/>gent, and my companions amiable. <lb n="c56-0012__main__3"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e440"/>and our stud<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e440"/> Our studies were never <lb n="c56-0012__main__4"/> forced, and by some means we al<lb n="c56-0012__main__5"/>ways had an end placed in view which <lb n="c56-0012__main__6"/> excited us to ardour.<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>in the prosecution of them. It was by this <mdel>&</mdel>method<lb n="c56-0012__main__7"/> not by emulation that we were <lb n="c56-0012__main__8"/> urged. Elizabeth was not told to apply <lb n="c56-0012__main__9"/> herself to drawing <mdel>or</mdel>that her companions <lb n="c56-0012__main__10"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e495"/>would<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e495"/>might not outstrip her, but <del sID="c56-0012__main__d2e502" type="overwritten"/>she<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e502"/>by<del next="#c56-0012.02" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e508"/>was<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e508"/>the<lb n="c56-0012__left_margin__1"/>desire of<lb n="c56-0012__main__11"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e527" xml:id="c56-0012.02"/>knew how<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e527"/> pleas<mdel>ed</mdel>ing her Aunt would <lb n="c56-0012__main__12"/> be by <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e547"/>a painting<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e547"/>the representation of some <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e554"/>of her<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e554"/><lb n="c56-0012__main__13"/> favourite scene<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e560"/>s<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e560"/> done by her own <lb n="c56-0012__main__14"/> hand. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e565"/>Latin<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e565"/> We learned Latin &<lb n="c56-0012__main__15"/> English <mdel>to</mdel>that we might read the writ<del sID="c56-0012__main__d2e581" type="overwritten"/>ers<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e581"/>ings<mdel>of</mdel>in those <lb n="c56-0012__main__16"/> languages and so far from study <lb n="c56-0012__main__17"/> begin rendered odious <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e599"/>by<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e599"/> to us th<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>rough<lb n="c56-0012__main__18"/> punishment, we loved application <lb n="c56-0012__main__19"/> and our amusements <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e625"/>were<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e625"/>would have been the <lb n="c56-0012__main__20"/> labours of other children. perhaps <lb n="c56-0012__main__21"/> we did not read so many books <lb n="c56-0012__main__22"/> or learn <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e639"/>a<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e639"/> languages so quickly <lb n="c56-0012__main__23"/> as <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e646"/>another child<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e646"/>those who are disciplined according to the ordinarymethod, but what we <lb n="c56-0012__main__24"/> learned was impressed the more deeply on our <lb n="c56-0012__main__25"/> memory. <metamark function="displacement" xml:id="c56-0012.05">X</metamark><lb n="c56-0012__left_margin__1"/><metamark function="displacement">X</metamark>In <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__left_margin__d2e685"/>this<del eID="c56-0012__left_margin__d2e685"/>thedescrip<lb n="c56-0012__left_margin__2"/>tion of our do<lb n="c56-0012__left_margin__3"/>mestic circle <lb n="c56-0012__left_margin__4"/> I include<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e712"/>I include<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e712"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e716"/>Hen<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e716"/> Henry <del next="#c56-0012.08" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e719"/>Carignan<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e719"/>Clerval,<lb n="c56-0012__main__26"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e728" xml:id="c56-0012.08"/>in this account<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e728"/> for <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>he was<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e745"/>con<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e745"/> constantly <lb n="c56-0012__main__27"/> with us. he went to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0012__main__d2e751"/>sho<del eID="c56-0012__main__d2e751"/> school <lb n="c56-0012__main__28"/> with me and generally passed <lb n="c56-0012__main__29"/> the afternoon at our house for<lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__1"/> being an only child, and desti<lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__2"/>tute of companions at home, h<mdel/>is<lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__3"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0013__Pt1__main__d2e789"/>to<del eID="c56-0013__Pt1__main__d2e789"/> father was pleased that he <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__4"/> should find associates at our <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__5"/> house and we were never com<lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__6"/>pletely happy when Clerval was <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__7"/> absent.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__8"/> In this account of my early <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__9"/> youth I wish particularly to men<lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__10"/>tion<lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__left_margin__1"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0013__Pt1__left_margin__d2e831"/>record <del eID="c56-0013__Pt1__left_margin__d2e831"/> those circumstances which <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__11"/> led to and nourished my taste <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__12"/> for that science which was <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__13"/> the principal amusement of my <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__14"/> boyish days and in the enddeci<lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__15"/>ded my destiny. I mentioned before <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__16"/> my taste for old books of chemist<lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__17"/>ry and natural magic and I remem<lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__18"/>ber very well that I learned latin <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__19"/> principally that I might read <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__20"/> Pliny's Natural History my father <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__21"/> refusing to allow me to read a <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__22"/> translation. I used when very young <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__23"/> to attend lectures of chemistry <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__24"/> given in Geneva and athough <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__25"/> I did not understand them the <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__26"/> experiments never failed to <lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__27"/> attract my attention.<del next="#c56-0013.06" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0013__Pt1__main__d2e899"/>I reme<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>mber<del eID="c56-0013__Pt1__main__d2e899"/><lb n="c56-0013__Pt1__main__28"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0013__Pt1__main__d2e917" xml:id="c56-0013.06"/>also<del eID="c56-0013__Pt1__main__d2e917"/><gap quantity="22" reason="resequencing" unit="tokens"/><gap quantity="4" reason="resequencing" unit="lines"/><lb n="c56-0005__main__1"/><milestone spanTo="#c56-0005.06" unit="tei:head"/>Chapt. 2<lb n="c56-0005__main__2"/> Those events which materially influence our fu<lb n="c56-0005__main__3"/>ture destinies <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e949"/>are<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e949"/> often <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e954"/>caused<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e954"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e957"/>by slight or<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e957"/>derive thier origin from atri<lb n="c56-0005__main__4"/>vial occurence<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e971"/>s<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e971"/>. <del next="#c56-0005.02" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e974"/>Strange as the<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e974"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e985"/>statement of the<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e985"/><del next="#c56-0005.03" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e992" xml:id="c56-0005.02"/>simple fact<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e992"/><lb n="c56-0005__main__5"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e998" xml:id="c56-0005.03"/>may appear my fate had been<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e998"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1001"/>Chemist<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1001"/>Natu<lb n="c56-0005__main__6"/>ral philosophy <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1013"/>has<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1013"/> is the genius that has <lb n="c56-0005__main__7"/> regulated my fate I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1020"/>wish<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1020"/>desire the<mdel>ir</mdel>refore in this account <lb n="c56-0005__main__8"/> of my early years to state those facts which <lb n="c56-0005__main__9"/> led to my<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1040"/>love<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1040"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1043"/>pursuit<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1043"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1046"/>first aqu<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1046"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1055"/>of that study.<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1055"/>predeliction for that science. When <lb n="c56-0005__main__10"/> I was eleven years old we all went on a party <lb n="c56-0005__main__11"/> of pleasure to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1068"/>Thonon<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1068"/>Thonon.<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1082"/>and were confined there<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1082"/><lb n="c56-0005__main__12"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1087"/>b<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1087"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1090"/>obil<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1090"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1093"/>obliged by the rain<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1093"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1096"/>and<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1096"/><mdel>t</mdel>The inclemen<lb n="c56-0005__main__13"/>cy of the weather obliged us to remain a day <lb n="c56-0005__main__14"/> confined to the inn. In this house I chanced <lb n="c56-0005__main__15"/> to fin<mdel>ed</mdel>d a <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1123"/>fo<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1123"/> volume<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1126"/>s<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1126"/> of the Works of Corne<lb n="c56-0005__main__16"/>lius Agrippa. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1136"/>And<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1136"/> I opened it with apathy <lb n="c56-0005__main__17"/><del next="#c56-0005.04" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1143"/>but<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1143"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the theory that he attempted to ddemonstrate and the wonderful facts thathe relates <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1160"/>chan<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1160"/> soon changed this feeling into<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1164" xml:id="c56-0005.04"/>continued to re with<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1164"/> enthusiasm. A new <lb n="c56-0005__main__18"/> light dawned upon my mind and <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1173"/>I<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1173"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1176"/>com<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1176"/><lb n="c56-0005__main__19"/> bounding with joy I communicated my <lb n="c56-0005__main__20"/> discovery to my father. I cannot help here remark<lb n="c56-0005__main__21"/>ing the many opportunities <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1192"/>parents<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1192"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>instructors<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1208"/>have<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1208"/>posess<lb n="c56-0005__main__22"/> of directing the attention of their pupils to <lb n="c56-0005__main__23"/> useful knowledge, which they utterly neglect. <lb n="c56-0005__main__24"/> My father looked carelessly at the tit<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1221"/>t<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1221"/>le page <lb n="c56-0005__main__25"/> of my book — <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1227"/>Ah<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1227"/> and said Ah! Cornelius <lb n="c56-0005__main__26"/> Agrippa! — My dear Victor do not waste <lb n="c56-0005__main__27"/> your time upon this – it is sad trash. <lb n="c56-0005__main__28"/> If instead of this remark or rather excla<lb n="c56-0005__main__29"/>mation my father had taken the pains to <lb n="c56-0005__main__30"/>exp<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0005__main__d2e1249"/>ound<del eID="c56-0005__main__d2e1249"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>lain to me that the principles of<lb n="c56-0006__main__1"/> Agrippa had been entirely exploded. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0006__main__d2e1275"/>And<del eID="c56-0006__main__d2e1275"/><lb n="c56-0006__main__2"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0006__main__d2e1280"/>aan<del eID="c56-0006__main__d2e1280"/> and that <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0006__main__d2e1285"/>another<del eID="c56-0006__main__d2e1285"/>a modernsystem of science <lb n="c56-0006__main__3"/> had been introduced which possessed much <lb n="c56-0006__main__4"/> greater power than the ancient because <lb n="c56-0006__main__5"/> the powers of the ancient were pretended <lb n="c56-0006__main__6"/> and chimerical, while those of the moderns <lb n="c56-0006__main__7"/> are real and practical; under such <lb n="c56-0006__main__8"/> circumstances I should certainly have thrown <lb n="c56-0006__main__9"/> Agrippa aside, and with my imagination <lb n="c56-0006__main__10"/> warmed as it was<mdel>w</mdel>should probably have <lb n="c56-0006__main__11"/> aplied myself to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0006__main__d2e1318"/>m<del eID="c56-0006__main__d2e1318"/> the more <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0006__main__d2e1321"/>ra<del eID="c56-0006__main__d2e1321"/> rational <lb n="c56-0006__main__12"/> theory of chemistry which <del next="#c56-0006.01" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0006__main__d2e1327"/>has at present<del eID="c56-0006__main__d2e1327"/>has resulted from modern discoveries<lb n="c56-0006__main__13"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0006__main__d2e1335" xml:id="c56-0006.01"/>the approbation of the learned.<del eID="c56-0006__main__d2e1335"/>It is even possible that the train of my ideas might never have recievedthat fatal impulse which led me to my ruin. But the <lb n="c56-0006__main__14"/> cursory glance my father had taken of <lb n="c56-0006__main__15"/> my volume by no means assured me <lb n="c56-0006__main__16"/> that he was acquainted with <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0006__main__d2e1355"/>the<del eID="c56-0006__main__d2e1355"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>its contents; <lb n="c56-0006__main__17"/> and I continued to read with the greatest <lb n="c56-0006__main__18"/> avidity. <milestone unit="tei:p"/><metamark function="paragraph">[</metamark>When I returned home, my first <lb n="c56-0006__main__19"/> care was to procure <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0006__main__d2e1382"/>this<del eID="c56-0006__main__d2e1382"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the<metamark function="insert">^</metamark>whole works of this <lb n="c56-0006__main__20"/> author and afterwards those of Paracel<lb n="c56-0006__main__21"/>sus and Albertus Magnus. I read and studied<lb n="c56-0006__main__22"/> the wild fancies of these authors with <lb n="c56-0006__main__23"/> delight, they appeared to me treasures <lb n="c56-0006__main__24"/> known to few besides myself; and, although<lb n="c56-0006__main__25"/> I often wished to <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0006__main__d2e1437"/>discover<del eID="c56-0006__main__d2e1437"/>communicate these secret stores <lb n="c56-0006__main__26"/> of knowledge <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0006__main__d2e1446"/>from<del eID="c56-0006__main__d2e1446"/> to my father yet his in<lb n="c56-0007__main__1"/>definite censure of my favorite Agrippa, <lb n="c56-0007__main__2"/> always withheld me. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0007__main__d2e1465"/>I let<del eID="c56-0007__main__d2e1465"/> I disclosed my secret <lb n="c56-0007__main__3"/> to Elizabeth therefore, under a strict promise <lb n="c56-0007__main__4"/> of secrecy; but she did not interest herself <lb n="c56-0007__main__5"/> in <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0007__main__d2e1477"/>them<del eID="c56-0007__main__d2e1477"/><mdel/>the subject, and I was left by her to pursue <lb n="c56-0007__main__6"/> my studies alone. –<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0007__main__7"/> It may appear very strange that a desci<lb n="c56-0007__main__8"/>ple of Albertus Magnus should arise in the <lb n="c56-0007__main__9"/> eighteenth century, but our family was not <lb n="c56-0007__main__10"/> scientifical, and I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0007__main__d2e1512"/>did<del eID="c56-0007__main__d2e1512"/>had not attended any of the <lb n="c56-0007__main__11"/> lectures given at Geneva. My dreams were <lb n="c56-0007__main__12"/> therefore undisturbed by reality, and I entered <lb n="c56-0007__main__13"/> with the greates diligence into the search <lb n="c56-0007__main__14"/> of the philosophers stone and the <note/>or if you chose petrum philosophale<del next="#c56-0007.02" rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0007__main__d2e1538"/>elizer vi<del eID="c56-0007__main__d2e1538"/>elixer of life<lb n="c56-0007__main__15"/><del rend=" strikethrough" sID="c56-0007__main__d2e1546" xml:id="c56-0007.02"/>tæ<del eID="c56-0007__main__d2e1546"/>. But the latter obtained my most undi<lb n="c56-0007__main__16"/>ved attention; wealth was an inferior <lb n="c56-0007__main__17"/> object but what would be the glory <lb n="c56-0007__main__18"/> of the discovery if I could <del rend=" strikethrough" sID="c56-0007__main__d2e1562"/>besto<del eID="c56-0007__main__d2e1562"/><del rend=" strikethrough" sID="c56-0007__main__d2e1565"/>forever<del When we <lb n="c56-0014__main__17"/> visited it the next morning we found <lb n="c56-0014__main__18"/> the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0014__main__d2e2229"/>trea<del eID="c56-0014__main__d2e2229"/> tree shattered in a <lb n="c56-0014__main__19"/> singular manner. It was not splin<lb n="c56-0014__main__20"/>tered by the shock, but entirely <lb n="c56-0014__main__21"/> reduced to thin ribands of wood. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0014__main__d2e2243"/>The<del eID="c56-0014__main__d2e2243"/><lb n="c56-0014__main__22"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0014__main__d2e2248"/>C<del eID="c56-0014__main__d2e2248"/> I never saw any thing so utterly <lb n="c56-0014__main__23"/> destroyed. On Elizabeth and <lb n="c56-0015__Pt1__main__2"/> Clerval it produced a <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0015__Pt1__main__d2e2341"/>di<del eID="c56-0015__Pt1__main__d2e2341"/> very different <lb n="c56-0015__Pt1__main__3"/> effect. They admired the beauty <lb n="c56-0015__Pt1__main__4"/> of the storm without wishing to <lb n="c56-0015__Pt1__main__5"/> analyze its causes. Henry said that <lb n="c56-0015__Pt1__main__6"/> the Fairies and giants were at <lb n="c56-0015__Pt1__main__7"/> war and Elizabeth attempted <lb n="c56-0015__Pt1__main__8"/> a picture of it.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0015__Pt1__main__9"/> As I grew older my attempts <lb n="c56-0015__Pt1__main__10"/> in science were of a higher nature. <lb n="c56-0015__Pt1__main__11"/> I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0015__Pt1__main__d2e2370"/>endeavou<del eID="c56-0015__Pt1__main__d2e2370"/> produced little earthquakes <lb n="c56-0015__Pt1__main__12"/> and tried every kind of combination <lb n="c56-0015__Pt1__main__13"/> of gasses <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0015__Pt1__main__d2e2378"/>to<del eID="c56-0015__Pt1__main__d2e2378"/> and elements to ascertain <lb n="c56-0015__Pt1__main__14"/> the results.<gap quantity="16" reason="resequencing" unit="lines"/><gap quantity="3" reason="resequencing" unit="lines"/><milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__4"/><mdel>An</mdel><mdel>d</mdel><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>Among other questions suggested by natural objects I <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0009__Pt2__main__d2e2419"/>as<del eID="c56-0009__Pt2__main__d2e2419"/> eagerly enquired of my father <lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__5"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0009__Pt2__main__d2e2427"/>what<del eID="c56-0009__Pt2__main__d2e2427"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>the nature & the origin of thunder and lightening. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0009__Pt2__main__d2e2440"/>was.<del eID="c56-0009__Pt2__main__d2e2440"/> He <lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__6"/> replied, electricity; describing at the same <lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__7"/> time the effect of that power. He <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0009__Pt2__main__d2e2449"/>made<del eID="c56-0009__Pt2__main__d2e2449"/>constructed<lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__8"/> a small electrical machine and exhi<lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__9"/>bited a few experiments and made a <lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__10"/> kite with a wire & string <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0009__Pt2__main__d2e2473"/>and<del eID="c56-0009__Pt2__main__d2e2473"/>which drew down <lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__11"/> that fluid from the clouds.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__12"/> This last <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0009__Pt2__main__d2e2486"/>blow<del eID="c56-0009__Pt2__main__d2e2486"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0009__Pt2__main__d2e2489"/>st<del eID="c56-0009__Pt2__main__d2e2489"/> stroke compleated <lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__13"/> the overthrow of Cornelius Agrippa, Albertus <lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__14"/> Magnus and Paracelsus, who had so long <lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__15"/> reigned the lords of my imagination. But <lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__16"/> by some fatality I did not feel enclined to <lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__17"/> commence any modern system and this <lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__18"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0009__Pt2__main__d2e2508"/>inclination<del eID="c56-0009__Pt2__main__d2e2508"/>disinclination was influenced by the following <lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__19"/> circumstance.<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__20"/> My father expressed a wish that I <lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__21"/> should attend a course of lectures upon <lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__22"/> natural philosophy, to which I <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>cheerfullyconsented and <lb n="c56-0009__Pt2__main__23"/>one evening that I spent in town at the I was also busily employed in learning <lb n="c56-0010__main__20"/> languages Latin was <metamark function="insert">^</metamark>already familiar to me and I began to <lb n="c56-0010__main__21"/> read without the help of the <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0010__main__d2e2801"/>dictionary<del eID="c56-0010__main__d2e2801"/>lexicon some of the <lb n="c56-0010__main__22"/> easiest greek authors. –I also understood English&<lb n="c56-0010__main__23"/> german perfectly: th<del rend="overwritten" sID="c56-0010__main__d2e2816"/>ese<del eID="c56-0010__main__d2e2816"/>is<del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0010__main__d2e2821"/>are<del eID="c56-0010__main__d2e2821"/>is list of my accom<lb n="c56-0010__main__24"/>plishments at <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0010__main__d2e2837"/>that<del eID="c56-0010__main__d2e2837"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0010__main__d2e2840"/>time<del eID="c56-0010__main__d2e2840"/><mdel>th</mdel><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0010__main__d2e2848"/>e period<del eID="c56-0010__main__d2e2848"/> the age of and you may <lb n="c56-0010__main__25"/> conceive that my hours were fully employd <lb n="c56-0010__main__26"/> in acquiring and maintaining a knowledge <lb n="c56-0010__main__27"/> of this various literature.<gap quantity="14" reason="resequencing" unit="lines"/><milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0015__Pt2__main__15"/>As I before mentioned my brothers <lb n="c56-0015__Pt2__main__16"/> were much younger than myself. <lb n="c56-0015__Pt2__main__17"/> Ernest the second of our family was five<milestone unit="tei:p"/><lb n="c56-0015__Pt2__main__18"/> Another task <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0015__Pt2__main__d2e2889"/>soon<del eID="c56-0015__Pt2__main__d2e2889"/><metamark function="insert">^</metamark>also devolved upon <lb n="c56-0015__Pt2__main__19"/> me when I became the instructor <lb n="c56-0015__Pt2__main__20"/> of my brothers. Ernest was five years <lb n="c56-0015__Pt2__main__21"/> younger than myself, and was my <lb n="c56-0015__Pt2__main__22"/> principal pupil. He had been aflicted <lb n="c56-0015__Pt2__main__23"/> with ill health from his infancy <mdel>&</mdel>thro which<lb n="c56-0015__Pt2__main__24"/> Elizabeth and I had been his constant <lb n="c56-0015__Pt2__main__25"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0015__Pt2__main__d2e2927"/>m<del eID="c56-0015__Pt2__main__d2e2927"/> nurses <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0015__Pt2__main__d2e2930"/>I<del eID="c56-0015__Pt2__main__d2e2930"/> his disposition was gentle but <lb n="c56-0015__Pt2__main__26"/> he was incapable any severe appli<lb n="c56-0015__Pt2__main__27"/>cation. William the younge<mdel>er</mdel>st of our <lb n="c56-0015__Pt2__main__28"/> family was quite a child and the <lb n="c56-0015__Pt2__main__29"/> most beautiful little fellow in the <lb n="c56-0015__Pt2__main__30"/> world, his lively blue eyes dimpled cheeks<lb n="c56-0016__main__1"/> and <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0016__main__d2e2967"/>affectionate<del eID="c56-0016__main__d2e2967"/> endearing manners <lb n="c56-0016__main__2"/> inspired the tenderest affection. Such <lb n="c56-0016__main__3"/> was our domestic circle from which <lb n="c56-0016__main__4"/> care and pain seemed for ever banish<lb n="c56-0016__main__5"/>ed. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0016__main__d2e2983"/>f<del eID="c56-0016__main__d2e2983"/> My father directed our studies <lb n="c56-0016__main__6"/> and my mother partook of our <lb n="c56-0016__main__7"/> enjoyments. <del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0016__main__d2e2993"/>we were all equal<del eID="c56-0016__main__d2e2993"/><lb n="c56-0016__left_margin__1"/><del rend="strikethrough" sID="c56-0016__left_margin__d2e3006"/>we none<del eID="c56-0016__left_margin__d2e3006"/>neither of <lb n="c56-0016__left_margin__2"/> us possessed <lb n="c56-0016__left_margin__3"/> an envied <lb n="c56-0016__left_margin__4"/> preheminence <lb n="c56-0016__left_margin__5"/> over the other the <lb n="c56-0016__main__8"/> voice of command was never heard <lb n="c56-0016__main__9"/> among us but mutual affection <lb n="c56-0016__main__10"/> engaged us all to comply with,&to<lb n="c56-0016__main__11"/> obey the slightest desire of each <lb n="c56-0016__main__12"/> other.
